newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish 3-yr bond prices seen falling at tender.
newsitem.headline: Polish 3-yr bond prices seen falling at tender.

text.p: Prices of Polish three-year floating bonds are seen falling at the treasury's 600 million primary tender on Tuesday, analysts said.
They said the auction of the bonds, maturing November 6, 1996, was likely to be undersubscribed and demand should not top 300 million zlotys.

"The fall of the bond's price is likely to match the significant decrease in the yield of the 13-week paper on which it is based, so that its yield might ease to 19.49 percent from the last 21.71 percent," said Elzbieta Milaczewska from BIG SA.
Analysts said the minimum price may fall below 100.00 from 100.60 at the last auction on July 23.
The coupon of the paper is set at five percent above the average yield of 13-week T-bills from four consecutive primary auctions in the month preceding the coupon payment.

The average primary yield of the 13-week T-bill fell to 18.55 percent at the last auction on Monday from 19.68 percent on July 22, 1996. The value date for the auction is November 4, 1996. -- Krzysztof Wojcik +48 22 653 9700
